00023 int     gOverlappingSimplePairs = 0;
00024 int gRemoveSimplePairs =0;
00025 int gAddedSimplePairs =0;
00026 int gFindSimplePairs =0;

00031 btHashedSimplePairCache::btHashedSimplePairCache() {
00032         int initialAllocatedSize= 2;
00033         m_overlappingPairArray.reserve(initialAllocatedSize);
00034         growTables();
00035 }

00049 void btHashedSimplePairCache::removeAllPairs()
00050 {
00051         m_overlappingPairArray.clear();
00052         m_hashTable.clear();
00053         m_next.clear();
00054 
00055         int initialAllocatedSize= 2;
00056         m_overlappingPairArray.reserve(initialAllocatedSize);
00057         growTables();
00058 }
00059

00061 
00062 btSimplePair* btHashedSimplePairCache::findPair(int indexA, int indexB)
00063 {
00064         gFindSimplePairs++;
00065         
00066         
00067         /*if (indexA > indexB) 
00068                 btSwap(indexA, indexB);*/
00069 
00070         int hash = static_cast<int>(getHash(static_cast<unsigned int>(indexA), static_cast<unsigned int>(indexB)) & (m_overlappingPairArray.capacity()-1));
00071 
00072         if (hash >= m_hashTable.size())
00073         {
00074                 return NULL;
00075         }
00076 
00077         int index = m_hashTable[hash];
00078         while (index != BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR && equalsPair(m_overlappingPairArray[index], indexA, indexB) == false)
00079         {
00080                 index = m_next[index];
00081         }
00082 
00083         if (index == BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR)
00084         {
00085                 return NULL;
00086         }
00087 
00088         btAssert(index < m_overlappingPairArray.size());
00089 
00090         return &m_overlappingPairArray[index];
00091 }
00092

00094 
00095 void    btHashedSimplePairCache::growTables()
00096 {
00097 
00098         int newCapacity = m_overlappingPairArray.capacity();
00099 
00100         if (m_hashTable.size() < newCapacity)
00101         {
00102                 //grow hashtable and next table
00103                 int curHashtableSize = m_hashTable.size();
00104 
00105                 m_hashTable.resize(newCapacity);
00106                 m_next.resize(newCapacity);
00107 
00108 
00109                 int i;
00110 
00111                 for (i= 0; i < newCapacity; ++i)
00112                 {
00113                         m_hashTable[i] = BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR;
00114                 }
00115                 for (i = 0; i < newCapacity; ++i)
00116                 {
00117                         m_next[i] = BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR;
00118                 }
00119 
00120                 for(i=0;i<curHashtableSize;i++)
00121                 {
00122         
00123                         const btSimplePair& pair = m_overlappingPairArray[i];
00124                         int indexA = pair.m_indexA;
00125                         int indexB = pair.m_indexB;
00126                         
00127                         int     hashValue = static_cast<int>(getHash(static_cast<unsigned int>(indexA),static_cast<unsigned int>(indexB)) & (m_overlappingPairArray.capacity()-1));     // New hash value with new mask
00128                         m_next[i] = m_hashTable[hashValue];
00129                         m_hashTable[hashValue] = i;
00130                 }
00131 
00132 
00133         }
00134 }
00135 
00136 btSimplePair* btHashedSimplePairCache::internalAddPair(int indexA, int indexB)
00137 {
00138 
00139         int     hash = static_cast<int>(getHash(static_cast<unsigned int>(indexA),static_cast<unsigned int>(indexB)) & (m_overlappingPairArray.capacity()-1));  // New hash value with new mask
00140 
00141 
00142         btSimplePair* pair = internalFindPair(indexA, indexB, hash);
00143         if (pair != NULL)
00144         {
00145                 return pair;
00146         }
00147 
00148         int count = m_overlappingPairArray.size();
00149         int oldCapacity = m_overlappingPairArray.capacity();
00150         void* mem = &m_overlappingPairArray.expandNonInitializing();
00151 
00152         int newCapacity = m_overlappingPairArray.capacity();
00153 
00154         if (oldCapacity < newCapacity)
00155         {
00156                 growTables();
00157                 //hash with new capacity
00158                 hash = static_cast<int>(getHash(static_cast<unsigned int>(indexA),static_cast<unsigned int>(indexB)) & (m_overlappingPairArray.capacity()-1));
00159         }
00160         
00161         pair = new (mem) btSimplePair(indexA,indexB);
00162 
00163         pair->m_userPointer = 0;
00164         
00165         m_next[count] = m_hashTable[hash];
00166         m_hashTable[hash] = count;
00167 
00168         return pair;
00169 }

00172 
00173 void* btHashedSimplePairCache::removeOverlappingPair(int indexA, int indexB)
00174 {
00175         gRemoveSimplePairs++;
00176         
00177 
00178         /*if (indexA > indexB) 
00179                 btSwap(indexA, indexB);*/
00180 
00181         int     hash = static_cast<int>(getHash(static_cast<unsigned int>(indexA),static_cast<unsigned int>(indexB)) & (m_overlappingPairArray.capacity()-1));
00182 
00183         btSimplePair* pair = internalFindPair(indexA, indexB, hash);
00184         if (pair == NULL)
00185         {
00186                 return 0;
00187         }
00188 
00189         
00190         void* userData = pair->m_userPointer;
00191 
00192 
00193         int pairIndex = int(pair - &m_overlappingPairArray[0]);
00194         btAssert(pairIndex < m_overlappingPairArray.size());
00195 
00196         // Remove the pair from the hash table.
00197         int index = m_hashTable[hash];
00198         btAssert(index != BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR);
00199 
00200         int previous = BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR;
00201         while (index != pairIndex)
00202         {
00203                 previous = index;
00204                 index = m_next[index];
00205         }
00206 
00207         if (previous != BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR)
00208         {
00209                 btAssert(m_next[previous] == pairIndex);
00210                 m_next[previous] = m_next[pairIndex];
00211         }
00212         else
00213         {
00214                 m_hashTable[hash] = m_next[pairIndex];
00215         }
00216 
00217         // We now move the last pair into spot of the
00218         // pair being removed. We need to fix the hash
00219         // table indices to support the move.
00220 
00221         int lastPairIndex = m_overlappingPairArray.size() - 1;
00222 
00223         // If the removed pair is the last pair, we are done.
00224         if (lastPairIndex == pairIndex)
00225         {
00226                 m_overlappingPairArray.pop_back();
00227                 return userData;
00228         }
00229 
00230         // Remove the last pair from the hash table.
00231         const btSimplePair* last = &m_overlappingPairArray[lastPairIndex];
00232                 /* missing swap here too, Nat. */ 
00233         int lastHash = static_cast<int>(getHash(static_cast<unsigned int>(last->m_indexA), static_cast<unsigned int>(last->m_indexB)) & (m_overlappingPairArray.capacity()-1));
00234 
00235         index = m_hashTable[lastHash];
00236         btAssert(index != BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR);
00237 
00238         previous = BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR;
00239         while (index != lastPairIndex)
00240         {
00241                 previous = index;
00242                 index = m_next[index];
00243         }
00244 
00245         if (previous != BT_SIMPLE_NULL_PAIR)
00246         {
00247                 btAssert(m_next[previous] == lastPairIndex);
00248                 m_next[previous] = m_next[lastPairIndex];
00249         }
00250         else
00251         {
00252                 m_hashTable[lastHash] = m_next[lastPairIndex];
00253         }
00254 
00255         // Copy the last pair into the remove pair's spot.
00256         m_overlappingPairArray[pairIndex] = m_overlappingPairArray[lastPairIndex];
00257 
00258         // Insert the last pair into the hash table
00259         m_next[pairIndex] = m_hashTable[lastHash];
00260         m_hashTable[lastHash] = pairIndex;
00261 
00262         m_overlappingPairArray.pop_back();
00263 
00264         return userData;
00265 }
00266 //#include <stdio.h>
